Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 06:43AM christine27 wrote: I really hope that it is something as simple as hormones for you as i do for myself but i am pushing for further tests because god forbid it does turn out to be cancer then i want it dealt with sooner rather than later. I am being fobbed off because my breast doesn't look overly different, but i know that it has grown slightly, feels heavier and hurts constantly and until i am told exactly why this is happening i will not give up. If you are not happy with how your situation has been left, seek a second opinion.x

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 06:30AM christine27 wrote: I said that to my gp and she said sometimes it can effect just one breast so maybe that is the case with you. I myself am not convinced that its the case for me. It is affecting my shoulder and arm and i can feel it all rapidly getting worse and i find it hard to believe it could all be hormonal. It makes me so mad that they think because we are young it couldn't possibly be cancer. Surely we have the right to find out one way or another!x
